title: Fix deployment-blocking Motoko compilation error in isVerifier

requirements.text: Fix the deployment-blocking Motoko compilation issue in `backend/main.mo` by ensuring `isVerifier(caller : Principal) : Bool` reliably returns a `Bool` value (specifically the result of `AccessControl.isAdmin(accessControlState, caller)`) so the canister compiles and authorization checks behave as intended wherever `isVerifier` is used.
acceptanceCriteria: `backend/main.mo` compiles successfully with no type errors related to `isVerifier`.
`isVerifier` returns `true` when `AccessControl.isAdmin(accessControlState, caller)` is `true`, and `false` otherwise.
All existing call sites (`getAchievement`, `getAchievementsByStudentId`, `searchAchievements`) continue to compile and apply verifier/admin visibility rules as before.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in `backend/main.mo`.
Only add `backend/migration.mo` if state shape changes require an upgrade migration (do not add one for this fix if unnecessary).
Do not edit frontend files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new roles/permissions beyond the existing admin-based verifier check.
UI/UX redesign or new frontend features.
